page.title: 01The Area Around Ponteland
page.content: The area just to the North West of Ponteland is predominantly typical Northumberland lowland farming area. The farming is approximately 50% intensive arable land growing barley,wheat,oats & oil seed rape the remaining 50% is intensively managed grassland supporting sheep & beef & dairy cows. The area includes the Northumbrian Police Headquarters,the CARE village for mentally handicapped people,a site for the tipping of domestic refuse and the Wagon Public House. A Northumberland County Council Highways Depot is sited in this area together with a factory manufacturing electrical fuses. Two large listed buildings,Benridge Hall & Hyham Dykes House are typical Northumbrian houses built from the fruits of the industrial revolution.
